root.description: The root concept of your model. Every instance of your model will begin with this concept.

min.description: Defines the minimum number of characters the user must input. This must be an integer value 0 or higher. If no minlength is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the input has no minimum length.

max.description: Defines the maximum number of characters the user can input. This must be an integer value 0 or higher. If no maxlength is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the input has no maximum length.

min.description: Defines the minimum value the user may input. This must be a positive integer lower or equal to the minimum value if specified. If no minimum is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the number has no minimum value restriction.

max.description: Defines the maximum value the user may input. This must be positive integer greater or equal to the minimum value if specified. If no minimum is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the number has no minimum value restriction.

min.description: Defines the minimum number of elements for the set. This must be a positive integer lower or equal to the maximum value if specified. If no minimum is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the set will use a minimum of 1

max.description: Defines the maximum number of elements for the set. This must be positive integer greater or equal to the minimum value if specified. If no minimum is specified, or an invalid value is specified, the set has no maximum value restriction.
